SENT.plain: Pancytopenia is a very rare condition associated with hepatitis A infection
We managed a 12 year old boy who had hepatitis A infection with anemia
His hemogram and bone marrow examination were suggestive of pancytopenia
Pancytopenia recovered without any specific therapy
There are case reports of severe aplastic anemia with hepatitis A infection that required immunosuppressive therapy
The present case did not require any aggressive therapy and recovered
In a young child with hepatitis A infection and anemia, bone marrow depression should be suspected
The pancytopenia may be transient as exemplified by the present case
